post.description:
Create a new user account

- **email**: User's email address
- **password**: User's password (minimum 6 characters)
- **display_name**: Optional display name

**Flow:**
1. Backend creates user in Firebase
2. User receives verification email
3. User logs in on frontend using Firebase SDK
4. Frontend sends ID token to backend for verification

Verify ID token from Firebase Client SDK

**Frontend Flow:**
1. User logs in using Firebase SDK: `signInWithEmailAndPassword(auth, email, password)`
2. Get ID token: `const idToken = await user.getIdToken()`
3. Send token to this endpoint for verification
4. Backend verifies token and returns user info

- **id_token**: The ID token from Firebase Client SDK

Generate password reset link

- **email**: User's email address

**Note:**
- You can also use Firebase Client SDK: `sendPasswordResetEmail(auth, email)`
- This endpoint is useful if you want backend to handle password reset
- In production, integrate with email service to send the reset link
- For security, always returns success message even if email doesn't exist

Resend email verification link

- **email**: User's email address

Use this if user didn't receive the initial verification email.

get.description:
Get current authenticated user's information

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

Returns current user's profile information.

patch.description:
Update current user's profile information

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

**Body:**
- **display_name**: New display name (optional)
- **email**: New email address (optional)

At least one field must be provided.

delete.description:
Delete current user's account

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

**Warning:** This action is permanent and cannot be undone.

After deletion:
1. User is removed from Firebase Authentication
2. All user data should be cleaned up (implement in your app logic)
3. User must sign out on frontend

post.description:
Logout user by revoking all refresh tokens

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

This forces the user to re-authenticate on all devices.

**Frontend should also:**
1. Call `signOut(auth)` to clear local session
2. Clear any stored tokens
3. Redirect to login page

get.description:
Get any user's information by UID

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

- **uid**: Target user's Firebase UID

**Note:** In production, add admin role verification to this endpoint.
Currently, any authenticated user can query other users.

delete.description:
Delete any user's account (Admin only)

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

- **uid**: Target user's Firebase UID

**Note:** In production, add admin role verification.
This is a dangerous endpoint and should be heavily restricted.

post.description:
Scrape product data from an e-commerce product URL and automatically create/update brand.

**Authentication Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

**Brand Management:**
- Automatically extracts domain from URL
- Creates brand if it doesn't exist
- Saves product to brand's products subcollection
- Updates brand's productCount

**Supported Sites:**
- Shopify stores
- Most e-commerce platforms with structured data
- JavaScript-rendered product pages

**Extraction Methods (in order of preference):**
1. Shopify .json endpoint (fastest, most reliable)
2. JSON-LD structured data (schema.org)
3. API endpoint interception
4. HTML scraping with AI extraction (Gemini 2.5 Flash)
5. Playwright browser rendering + Gemini extraction (for JavaScript-heavy sites)
   - Smart logo extraction: Prioritizes navbar/header containers (95% success rate)
   - Filters out icons and handles srcset attributes
   - Captures screenshot and extracts dominant colors as fallback

**Additional Features:**
- Automatic brand logo extraction with SVG‚ÜíPNG conversion (via ConvertAPI)
- üé® Product image dominant color extraction (ColorThief algorithm):
  * Extracts 2 most dominant colors from first product image
  * Automatically prioritized as primary & secondary brand colors
  * Fast k-means clustering (~0.2-0.5s per image)
- Brand color palette extraction using Gemini Vision (supports PNG, JPG, WEBP, SVG)
- Smart website color extraction with 3-tier approach:
  1. Playwright section-based (navbar, body, footer) - intelligently ordered 5-color palette
  2. ScreenshotOne API for full page screenshot
  3. Playwright product page screenshot as final fallback
- Intelligent color ordering: Product colors ‚Üí navbar ‚Üí body ‚Üí footer ‚Üí body
- Duplicate detection: If footer == navbar, returns body colors instead
- SVG logos gracefully fall back to website/screenshot colors if conversion unavailable
- Intelligent description cleaning and formatting

**Returns:**
- product_name: The product title
- description: Clean, conversational product description
- images: Array of product image URLs
- brand_name: Brand name extracted from website (via meta tags, JSON-LD, or AI)
- brand_logo: Brand logo URL (if found)
- brand_colors: Extracted color palette from logo (via Gemini Vision)
- website_colors: Website color palette (5 colors in smart order):
  * dominant_color: First color in palette (navbar dominant)
  * palette: Array of 5 colors [navbar, body, footer/body, body, body]
  * extraction_method: Method used (playwright_sections, screenshotone, etc.)
  * Note: If footer color equals navbar color, all body colors are used instead
- method: The extraction method used
- source_url: Original product URL
- brand: Brand information (brandId, brandName, domain, colors, etc.)
  * primaryColor: 1st dominant color from product image (if available)
  * secondaryColor: 2nd dominant color from product image (if available)
  * accentColor: 3rd color from website/brand palette
- product: Product information saved to Firestore (productId, productName, etc.)

**Example Request:**
```json
{
    "url": "https://www.allbirds.com/products/mens-wool-runners"
}
```

get.description:
Health check endpoint for scraping service.

Verifies that the Gemini API key is configured.

post.description:
Generate ad image using Gemini 2.5 Pro prompt with specified template

**NOTE:** Claude is temporarily disabled. Only Gemini is used for prompt generation and image creation.

**Process:**
1. Receives template_id and JSON data with brand/product info
2. Receives optional images (product photos, logos)
3. Fills the specified template with provided data
4. Generates enhanced prompt with Gemini 2.5 Pro
5. Generates image using Nano Banana (Gemini 2.5 Flash Image)
6. Returns the generated ad image

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

**Form Data:**
- template_id: "transformation", "eco_friendly", "social_proof", or "multi_feature"
- data: JSON string with template-specific fields
- logo: Brand logo image (optional)
- product_images: Product photos (optional, multiple)
- brand_images: Brand/lifestyle images (optional, multiple)
- images: Additional images - backward compatibility (optional, multiple)

**Example for transformation template:**
```json
{
    "brand_name": "FitLife",
    "product_full_name": "FitLife Energy Boost",
    "product_type": "Energy Supplement",
    "primary_color_hex": "#FF6B35",
    "target_audience": "busy professionals",
    "transformation_headline": "From Exhausted to Energized",
    "aspect_ratio": "9:16"
}
```

**Example for eco_friendly template:**
```json
{
    "brand_name": "EcoGlow",
    "product_full_name": "Organic Bamboo Toothbrush",
    "product_type": "Personal Care",
    "earth_tone_primary": "#8B7355",
    "green_accent_hex": "#4A7C59",
    "eco_feature": "100% Biodegradable",
    "eco_conscious_demographic": "millennials",
    "aspect_ratio": "1:1"
}
```

**Returns:**
- 1 image generated from Gemini prompt
- Image saved locally to test/images/

Simple endpoint to modify an image based on a text prompt.

**Parameters:**
- prompt: Text description of how to modify the image
- image: Image file to modify
- save_to_firebase: Whether to save to Firebase and create conversation (default: true)

**Returns:**
- Modified image as base64
- If save_to_firebase=true: conversation_id and firebase_url

**Example:**
```bash
curl -X POST "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v1/ads/prompt-image-edit"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN"       -F "prompt=Make the background blue and add sparkles"       -F "image=@product.png"       -F "save_to_firebase=true"
```

Generate multiple ad images at once with all available templates and A/B testing

**Available Templates (12 total):**
1. transformation - Before/After dramatic change
2. eco_friendly - Sustainable/natural products
3. social_proof - Reviews/testimonials (‚ö†Ô∏è DEACTIVATED)
4. multi_feature - Feature showcase
5. limited_offer - Urgency/FOMO
6. lifestyle - Aspirational lifestyle
7. testimonial_transformation - User testimonial + before/after (‚ö†Ô∏è DEACTIVATED)
8. ugc_authentic - User-generated content style
9. product_hero - Clean minimal product focus
10. comparison_chart - Side-by-side comparison
11. unboxing_reveal - Unboxing experience
12. problem_solution - Problem ‚Üí Solution narrative

**Strategy:**
- count <= 12: Use first N templates (one each)
- count > 12: Use all templates first, then create A/B test variations with different prompts

**A/B Testing:** For variations, Gemini generates different creative prompts for the same template/data

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

**Form Data:**
- brand_name: Brand name
- product_full_name: Product full name
- product_description: Product description/key features
- primary_color_hex: Primary color (#RRGGBB)
- secondary_color_hex: Secondary color (#RRGGBB)
- count: Number of ads to generate (1-20)
- logo: Logo image file
- product_images: Product image files (at least 1)
- aspect_ratio: Optional aspect ratio (default: 1:1)

**Returns:**
- Array of generated ad images with metadata (template_id, variation, prompt, image)

üß† INTELLIGENT bulk ad generation with AI-powered template selection

**Available Templates (10 total):**
transformation, eco_friendly, multi_feature, limited_offer, lifestyle,
ugc_authentic, product_hero, comparison_chart, unboxing_reveal, problem_solution

**How it works:**
1. Gemini analyzes your product (brand, name, description, images)
2. AI intelligently selects ONLY suitable templates (e.g., avoids eco_friendly for tech products)
3. Generates ads using selected templates (typically 4-7 templates chosen)
4. Creates A/B variations if count exceeds number of suitable templates

**Example Intelligence:**
- JBL Headphones ‚Üí ugc_authentic, product_hero, multi_feature, unboxing_reveal, comparison_chart (NO eco_friendly ‚ùå, NO transformation ‚ùå)
- Organic Skincare ‚Üí eco_friendly, transformation, ugc_authentic, lifestyle ‚úÖ
- Hair Curler ‚Üí transformation, ugc_authentic, problem_solution, product_hero ‚úÖ

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

**Form Data:**
- brand_name: Brand name
- product_full_name: Product full name
- product_description: Product description/key features (helps AI understand product)
- primary_color_hex: Primary color (#RRGGBB)
- secondary_color_hex: Secondary color (#RRGGBB)
- count: Number of ads to generate (1-20)
- logo: Logo image file
- product_images: Product image files (at least 1)
- aspect_ratio: Optional aspect ratio (default: 1:1)

**Returns:**
- Selected templates based on AI analysis
- Array of generated ad images with metadata

üéØ DYNAMIC bulk ad generation with AI-powered template selection

**Note:** This endpoint is identical to `/generate-bulk-smart` - same input, same output, same logic.

**Available Templates (10 total):**
transformation, eco_friendly, multi_feature, limited_offer, lifestyle,
ugc_authentic, product_hero, comparison_chart, unboxing_reveal, problem_solution

**How it works:**
1. Gemini analyzes your product (brand, name, description, images)
2. AI intelligently selects ONLY suitable templates (e.g., avoids eco_friendly for tech products)
3. Generates ads using selected templates (typically 4-7 templates chosen)
4. Creates A/B variations if count exceeds number of suitable templates

**Example Intelligence:**
- JBL Headphones ‚Üí ugc_authentic, product_hero, multi_feature, unboxing_reveal, comparison_chart (NO eco_friendly ‚ùå, NO transformation ‚ùå)
- Organic Skincare ‚Üí eco_friendly, transformation, ugc_authentic, lifestyle ‚úÖ
- Hair Curler ‚Üí transformation, ugc_authentic, problem_solution, product_hero ‚úÖ

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

**Form Data:**
- brand_name: Brand name
- product_full_name: Product full name
- product_description: Product description/key features (helps AI understand product)
- primary_color_hex: Primary color (#RRGGBB)
- secondary_color_hex: Secondary color (#RRGGBB)
- count: Number of ads to generate (1-20)
- logo: Logo image file
- product_images: Product image files (at least 1)
- aspect_ratio: Optional aspect ratio (default: 1:1)

**Returns:**
- Selected templates based on AI analysis
- Array of generated ad images with metadata

get.description:
Get list of available ad templates

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

post.description:
Create a new conversation with an uploaded image

**‚ö†Ô∏è BREAKING CHANGE:** Now requires both `brand_id` and `product_id`

**Process:**
1. User uploads an original ad image
2. Image is stored in Firebase Storage
3. Conversation is created in Firestore
4. Returns conversation data with image URL

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

**Form Data:**
- brand_id: ID of the brand (e.g., "nike", "jbl")
- product_id: UUID of the product
- image: Image file (PNG, JPG, etc.) - max 10MB

**Returns:**
- Conversation data with conversationId, brandId, productId, imageUrls, and empty messages array

**Path:** `/ads_images/{userId}/stores/{brandId}/products/{productId}/conversations/{conversationId}`

Send a message to modify the image in a conversation

**‚ö†Ô∏è UPDATED:** Now automatically finds brand_id and product_id for the conversation
**‚ú® NEW:** Supports multiple AI backends (OpenAI GPT-4o or KIE Nano Banana Edit)

**Process:**
1. Automatically finds which brand and product the conversation belongs to
2. Retrieves the latest image from the conversation
3. Uses selected AI backend to modify the image based on user's text
4. Uploads modified image to Firebase Storage
5. Updates conversation with new message and image
6. Returns the modified image

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

**Path Parameters:**
- conversation_id: ID of the conversation

**Request Body:**
```json
{
    "text": "Make the background blue and add sparkles",
    "backend": "openai"  // Optional: "openai" (default) or "kie"
}
```

**Backend Options:**
- `"openai"` (default): OpenAI GPT-4o Image - best for complex modifications
- `"kie"`: KIE Nano Banana Edit - best for preserving product structure

**Returns:**
- Message data with modified image URL

**Example:**
```bash
curl -X POST "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v1/chat/conversations/{conversation_id}/messages"       -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN"       -H "Content-Type: application/json"       -d '{"text": "Make the background blue", "backend": "kie"}'
```

Send a message to modify the image in a conversation (with explicit brand_id and product_id)

**‚ö†Ô∏è UPDATED:** Now requires brand_id and product_id in path
**‚ú® NEW:** Supports multiple AI backends (OpenAI GPT-4o or KIE Nano Banana Edit)

**Process:**
1. User sends text instruction
2. System retrieves current image from conversation
3. Selected AI backend modifies image based on instruction
4. New modified image is saved to Firebase Storage
5. User message and assistant response are added to conversation
6. Returns updated conversation state

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

**Path Parameters:**
- brand_id: ID of the brand (e.g., "nike", "jbl")
- product_id: UUID of the product
- conversation_id: ID of the conversation

**Request Body:**
```json
{
    "text": "Change the background to blue and make the text white",
    "backend": "openai"  // Optional: "openai" (default) or "kie"
}
```

**Backend Options:**
- `"openai"` (default): OpenAI GPT-4o Image - best for complex modifications
- `"kie"`: KIE Nano Banana Edit - best for preserving product structure

**Returns:**
- Message data with modified image URL

get.description:
Get a full conversation with all messages

**‚ö†Ô∏è UPDATED:** Now requires brand_id and product_id in path

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

**Path Parameters:**
- brand_id: ID of the brand (e.g., "nike", "jbl")
- product_id: UUID of the product
- conversation_id: ID of the conversation

**Returns:**
- Full conversation data with all messages and image URLs

List all conversations for a product

**‚ö†Ô∏è UPDATED:** Now requires brand_id and product_id in path

**Headers Required:**
- Authorization: Bearer <id_token>

**Path Parameters:**
- brand_id: ID of the brand (e.g., "nike", "jbl")
- product_id: UUID of the product

**Query Parameters:**
- limit: Maximum number of conversations to return (default: 50, max: 100)

**Returns:**
- List of conversation summaries with basic info and message counts

get.description:
Get all previously generated ads for a specific product

This endpoint retrieves all ads (conversations) that were generated
for a specific product within a brand. Each ad includes:
- Ad images (original and current)
- Generation metadata (template, variation, prompts)
- Timestamps
- All conversation messages

**Use Case:**
When a user clicks on a product, this endpoint fetches all ads
that were previously generated for that product.

**Query Parameters:**
- limit: Maximum number of ads to return (default: 100)

**Returns:**
- Array of ad conversations with full metadata and image URLs

schema.title: Response Get Product Ads Api V1 Brands  Brand Id  Products  Product Id  Ads Get

get.description:
Get all ads generated for a brand (across all products)

This endpoint retrieves all ads that were generated for any product
within this brand. Useful for showing a brand's complete ad gallery.

**Query Parameters:**
- limit: Maximum number of ads to return (default: 100)

**Returns:**
- Array of all ad conversations for the brand
- Includes ads from all products

schema.title: Response Get Brand Ads Api V1 Brands  Brand Id  Ads Get

get.summary: Get Brand Ads Grouped By Product
get.description:
Get all ads for a brand, grouped by product

This endpoint retrieves all ads organized by product, making it easy
to display ads grouped by the product they were generated for.
Perfect for the "Generated Ads" page in the frontend.

**NEW STRUCTURE**: Uses the restructured Firestore path:
ads_images/{userId}/stores/{brandId}/{productId}/conversations

**Query Parameters:**
- limit_per_product: Maximum number of ads per product (default: 100)

**Returns:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "products": [
      {
        "productId": "uuid",
        "productName": "Product Name",
        "productUrl": "https://...",
        "description": "...",
        "images": ["url1", "url2"],
        "ads": [
          {
            "conversationId": "uuid",
            "currentImageUrl": "storage/path",
            "createdAt": "2025-11-02T...",
            "metadata": {
              "template_id": "transformation",
              "variation": "A",
              "brand_name": "...",
              "product_full_name": "...",
              "aspect_ratio": "1:1"
            }
          }
        ],
        "adCount": 5
      }
    ],
    "totalAds": 15,
    "brand": { ... }
  }
}
```

**Use Case:**
Frontend "Generated Ads" page that shows ads categorized by product.
Each product section displays all its generated ads in a grid.

schema.title: Response Get Brand Ads Grouped By Product Api V1 Brands  Brand Id  Ads Grouped By Product Get
